title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.15.13 - 15 | 05-12-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyana Timiraandhasya Gyananjanishalakaya
Chakshurun Militam Jena Tasvai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Srimate Bhaktivedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatyade Shatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhi Gaurabhakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya
Narayanam Namaskritya Naramchaiva Narottamam
Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from
three verses 13, 14 and 15 of the 15th chapter
of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
The 13th verse first
Tatraiva Mev Viharato Bhujadanda Yugvam
Gandiva Lakshanam Arati Vadhaya Devaha
Sendra Shrita Yad Anubhavitam Aaja Meedha
Tenah Madhya Mushita Purushena Bhumah
Meaning of this verse is
When I stayed for some days as a guest in the heavenly planets
all the heavenly demigods including King Indradeva
took shelter of my arms which were marked with the Gandiva bow
to kill the demon named Nivartakavacha
O King, descendant of Aja Meedha
at the present moment
I am dead to you.
I am dead to you.
I am dead to you.
I am dead to you.
I am bereft of the supreme personality of Godhead
by whose influence I was so powerful.
So Arjuna is recollecting
when he went to the heavenly planets
he stayed there some time
under the grace of Krishna
even Indra was taking shelter
of the protection of Arjuna
because Arjuna was expert in using his Gandiva bow
to kill the misguided demon
to kill the miscreants.
So there was one demon by name Nivartakavacha
he was troubling the demigods
but he was killed by Arjuna
using his Gandiva bow.
So that is being recollected by Arjuna.
O King, descendant of Aja Meedha
at the present moment
I am bereft of the supreme personality of Godhead.
Arjuna is feeling the separation from Krishna.
After Krishna departed for his own personal abode
where he is eternally situated.
So in the purport,
Srila Prabhupada gives this brief purport.
He says,
The heavenly demigods are certainly more intelligent,
powerful and beautiful
and yet they had to take help from Arjuna
because of his Gandiva bow
which was empowered by the grace of Lord Sri Krishna.
It is not simply another weapon
or another bow
or another set of arrows, no.
It was the
Gandiva bow
which Arjuna was actually having
and which is described as transcendental
in the hands of the pure devotees
or the Supreme Lord
whatever be
the particular item
it is all auspicious.
The Lord is all powerful
and by his grace
his pure devotee can be as powerful as he may desire
and there is no limit to it.
And when the Lord withdraws his power from anyone
he is powerless by the will of the Lord.
So devotees powerful or powerless
according to the will of the Lord
is completely surrendered.
He does not demand.
The fourteenth verse
The meaning of this verse is
The military strength of the cowrovers
was like an ocean
in which there dwelled many invincible existences
and thus it was insurmountable.
But because of his friendship
I, seated on the chariot
was able to cross over it
and only by his grace
was I able to regain the cows
and also collect by force
many helmets of the kings
which were bedecked with jewels
that were sources of all brilliance.
Again Arjuna is recollecting
that the battle of Kurukshetra
the cowrover's strength was formidable
almost unconquerable
but by the grace of Krishna
Arjuna was able to conquer it.
Arjuna was able to defeat the cowrovers
and defeat them.
And even in the fight against the cowrovers
when they attacked the Pandavas
while the Pandavas were in exile
by the grace of Krishna only
Arjuna was able to defeat the cowrovers
who had defeated them.
Who had stolen the cows
of the king of Virat Pradesh.
So all this is possible only by the grace of Krishna.
So Srila Prabhupada explains in the purport
On the cowrover's side
there were many stalwart commanders
like Bhishma, Drona, Kripa and Kripa.
And their military strength
was as insurmountable as the great ocean.
And yet it is due to Lord Krishna's grace
that Arjuna was alone sitting on the chariot.
Even then he could manage to vanquish
the cowrovers one after another without difficulty.
Even though their strength was more.
But Krishna's grace
and Arjuna was able to defeat the cowrovers
even though their strength was insurmountable.
Now another interesting point Prabhupada says
There were many changes of commanders on the other side.
That means on the cowrover's side.
But on the Pandava's side
Arjuna alone in the chariot driven by Lord Krishna
could manage the whole responsibility of the great war.
See the mercy of the Lord Krishna on the Pandavas.
Especially on Arjuna.
Similarly when the Pandavas were living
at the palace of Virata incognito
that was the challenge offered by the cowrovers.
That the Pandavas lost the gambling match
and they had to go to the forest.
12 years just live in the forest.
And 13th year live in exile.
So even while the Pandavas were living in incognito condition in the exile.
The cowrovers picked a quarrel.
And decided to take away his large number of cows
of the place where the Pandavas had sought shelter.
Arjuna actually fought with those cowrovers
even remaining incognito.
And he was able to rescue the cows.
So Arjuna remembered
all this was possible because
of the grace of Krishna.
The 15th verse
yobhishmakarana gurushalya chamushvadabhra
rajanyavarya rathamandalamanditasu
agrecharomamavibhorathayuthapanam
ayurmanamsi
chadrusha saha oja archat
The meaning of this verse is
it was he only who withdrew the duration of life from everyone.
And who in the battlefield
withdrew the speculative power and strength
of enthusiasm from the great military phalanx made by the cowrovers
headed by Bhishma, Karna, Drona, Shalya etc.
Their arrangement was expert and more than adequate.
But he Lord Shri Krishna
was going forward with
all this.
Sorry.
But he Lord Krishna while going forward did all this.
He shortened the duration of the life.
He enabled Arjuna to cross over the mighty ocean of
strength of the cowrovers.
So in the purport Shri Ram Prabhupada says
The absolute personality of Godhead Lord Shri Krishna
expands himself by his plenary Paramatma portion in everyone's heart.
And thus he directs everyone in the matter of recollection,
forgetfulness, knowledge,
the absence of intelligence and all psychological activities.
This is stated in the 15th chapter, 15th verse of the Bhagavad Gita.
sarvasya caaham hrithi sannivitam
matta smritir jnanam apohanam ca
Krishna is seated in everyone's heart
regardless of whether they are devotee or not devotee.
And Krishna only gives someone intelligence.
Krishna only gives someone knowledge like that.
So it is further described by Shri Ram Prabhupada
As the Supreme Lord
He can increase or decrease the duration of life of a living being.
It is in Krishna's hands our duration of life.
Thus the Lord conducted the battle of Kurukshetra
according to his own plan.
He wanted that battle to establish Yudhishthira
as the emperor of this planet.
So the battle of Kurukshetra was arranged by Krishna.
Even though it looked like the Pandavas and Kauravas
could not make a settlement of sharing the kingdom,
but when a Kshatriya is offered a challenge,
he cannot refuse.
It is considered that he is not a worthy Kshatriya.
So this
battle of Kurukshetra was planned by Krishna
in order to establish Yudhishthira
as the emperor of the planet.
This was Krishna's plan.
And Krishna also facilitated the transcendental business
to kill all who were on the opposite side
by his omnipotent will.
Krishna simply has to will.
Everything happens whatever he wills.
So that was also possible only by the grace of Krishna.
The other party, that is the Kauravas party,
was equipped with all military strength
supported by big generals like Bhishma, Drona, Shalya,
and it would have been physically impossible
for Arjuna to win the battle
had the Lord not helped him by every kind of tactic.
So Krishna out of his mercy,
causeless mercy,
on his affectionate devotee,
he enabled Arjuna to actually face the army,
defeat the army of the Kauravas,
and actually win the battle.
And even before the battle,
the Pandavas and Arjuna were protected by Krishna.
So I will stop here.
Thank you very much.
Hare Krishna.
